intro: Eriogonum rosense var. rosense, commonly known as the Rosy Buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its dense,丛生的 growth habit and clusters of small, showy pink to reddish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are usually narrow and gray-green, with a fuzzy texture. It is adapted to arid environments and plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
